# Recipe: Crockpot Beef Bourguignon

- [Frequently Asked Questions](#frequently-asked-questions)

## Introduction
Crockpot Beef Bourguignon is a classic French dish that originated in the Burgundy region. It is a hearty and flavorful stew made with tender beef, red wine, and aromatic vegetables. This slow-cooked dish is perfect for a cozy family dinner or a special occasion.

## Ingredients
- 2 pounds beef chuck, cut into 1-inch cubes
- 4 slices bacon, chopped
- 1 onion, diced
- 2 carrots, sliced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 8 ounces mushrooms, sliced
- 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
- 2 cups red wine (such as Burgundy or Pinot Noir)
- 2 cups beef broth
- 2 tablespoons tomato paste
- 1 teaspoon dried thyme
- 2 bay leaves
- Salt and pepper, to taste
- Fresh parsley, for garnish

## Equipment
- Crockpot or slow cooker
- Skillet or frying pan
- Cutting board
- Knife
- Wooden spoon or spatula
- Measuring cups and spoons

## Preparation Time
- 20 minutes

## Cooking Time
- 6-8 hours

## Steps
1. In a skillet over medium heat, cook the bacon until crispy. Remove the bacon from the skillet and set aside.
2. Season the beef cubes with salt and pepper. In the same skillet with the bacon fat, brown the beef cubes on all sides. Transfer the beef to the crockpot.
3. In the same skillet, add the diced onion, sliced carrots, minced garlic, and sliced mushrooms. Cook until the vegetables are softened, about 5 minutes.
4. Sprinkle the flour over the vegetables and stir well to coat. Cook for another minute to cook off the raw flour taste.
5. Pour the red wine into the skillet and scrape up any browned bits from the bottom of the pan. Add the beef broth, tomato paste, dried thyme, and bay leaves. Stir to combine.
6. Transfer the vegetable and wine mixture to the crockpot with the beef. Stir everything together.
7. Cover the crockpot and cook on low heat for 6-8 hours or until the beef is tender.
8. Once cooked, remove the bay leaves and taste the stew. Adjust the seasoning with salt and pepper if needed.
9. Serve the Crockpot Beef Bourguignon hot, garnished with the crispy bacon and fresh parsley.

## Serving Suggestions
- Crockpot Beef Bourguignon is traditionally served with crusty bread or mashed potatoes to soak up the flavorful sauce. You can also serve it with buttered noodles or steamed rice.
- Pair this dish with a glass of red wine, such as Burgundy or Pinot Noir, to complement the flavors.

## Variations
- For a healthier version, you can use lean beef or substitute some of the beef with mushrooms to reduce the meat content.
- Add pearl onions or frozen peas to the stew for additional flavor and texture.
- Experiment with different herbs and spices, such as rosemary or thyme, to personalize the dish to your taste.

## Tips and Tricks
- For a richer flavor, marinate the beef overnight in red wine before cooking.
- If you prefer a thicker sauce, mix 1 tablespoon of cornstarch with 2 tablespoons of water and stir it into the stew during the last 30 minutes of cooking.
- If you don't have a crockpot, you can also cook this dish in a Dutch oven on the stovetop or in the oven at 325°F (163°C) for 2-3 hours.

## Nutritional Information

- Calories: 350

## Storage and Leftovers
- Store any leftovers in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
- Crockpot Beef Bourguignon can also be frozen for up to 3 months. Thaw in the refrigerator overnight before reheating.

## Frequently Asked Questions
1. Can I use a different cut of beef?
   - Yes, you can use other cuts of beef suitable for stewing, such as beef stew meat or bottom round.
2. Can I use white wine instead of red wine?
   - While red wine is traditional in Beef Bourguignon, you can use white wine as a substitute if desired. Just keep in mind that it will alter the flavor profile of the dish.
3. Can I make this recipe without alcohol?
   - If you prefer not to use alcohol, you can substitute the red wine with beef broth or a combination of beef broth and grape juice for a similar depth of flavor.
4. Can I cook this recipe on high heat in the crockpot?
   - While it is possible to cook this recipe on high heat for a shorter time, the low and slow cooking method will result in more tender and flavorful beef.
